subject: Re: [junit] Detecting failure in tearDown()
msgSnippet: ...  No. That certainly works. You have introduced a BaseTestCase. I don t know why I didn t think of that. :) -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
Frohnhofer, Jim wrote:

> In a similar, but simpler version of a previous poster, is there anything
> wrong (philosophically or technically) with the following class?
<snip />

No. That certainly works. You have introduced a BaseTestCase. I don't
know why I didn't think of that. :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
